p: Plasma-mediated virus inactivation is a relatively young field of research (reviewed in [ 14, 15]) which started only about 20 years ago [ 16]. This is despite the decades-old knowledge that ozone, that is usually synthesized from O 2 subjected to plasma conditions, can inactivate viruses [ 17]. However, over the past few years the number of publications in the CPâ€“virus field has doubled, and research has expanded from only defining the virucidal properties of plasma to describing its modes of inactivation.
